items.title: AI won’t cure ‘the infinite workday’ unless companies reengineer work, Microsoft says
items.description: Automating existing processes provides limited gains. Bigger leaps come from new workflows and organizational structures.

items.title: Ethereum critics say it has failed—but boosters say cryptocurrency has become ‘digital oil’
items.description: The second largest cryptocurrency has lagged behind Bitcoin in price and is still about 50% below all-time highs in 2021.

items.title: Louisiana’s plan to pay college athletes more money? Tax the sports-betting apps
items.description: “Without the athletes, we wouldn’t have the revenue," said Republican state Rep. Neil Riser, who sponsored the bill.

items.title: Arthur Folasa Ah Loo, the 39-year-old killed at the ‘No Kings’ protest, was a Project Runway contestant and designed clothing for ‘Moana 2’
items.description: Ah Loo leaves behind a wife and two young children, according to a GoFundMe page for his family.

items.title: The ‘Godfather of AI’ says this sector will be safe from being replaced by tech—but even then, only the ‘very skilled’ will hold down a job
items.description: Ex-Google AI boss Geoffery Hinton has a stark prediction for workers: Most of you are about to get replaced. Anthropic's and Klarna’s CEOs have issued...
